channel.title: [Delta] Random Login Freeze
channel.description:
Okay i've had this issue for quite some time, i've heard of others having the same issue
so hopefully someone will know if there is possibly a solution for it
note: this bug is completely random, it doesn't do it all the time but it does it often enough to cause an issue.
okay so then, the bug goes like this
the player logs in, after login is finished, the player is unable to move, click any buttons, talk, etc All of their actions are disregarded, there only option is to restart their client.
After tons of debugs and testing, i've found that it randomly spits out 3-5 random packets ranging from 1-255
if anyone has any idea about this or any solutions, please let me know, any help is appreciated. thank you very much!

item.title: [Delta] Random Login Freeze
item.dc:creator: @Dan0194 Dan0194
item.description:
@Dan0194 wrote:

Yah something is wrong with your client/server, do some debugging but if you can’t figure out what it is, i would get a new source and client.

Read full topic

item.title: [Delta] Random Login Freeze
item.dc:creator: @Team_Rocket Team_Rocket
item.description:
@Team_Rocket wrote:

Sounds like a miscommunication between the Client/Server. Atomic is correct.

Read full topic

item.title: [Delta] Random Login Freeze
item.dc:creator: @jal_knight jal knight
item.description:
@jal_knight wrote:

[quote=“silabgarza, post:10, topic:471568”][quote author=AtomicInt_ link=topic=589174.msg4175410#msg4175410 date=1354937894]

well i believe it has something to do with my client
as far as i remember, it didn’t happen back int 2010/2011 with project fuubergen client as base
but now in 2011 i started using runelimited, and i believe that’s when this issue started happening
i’ve done so much work on the client and can’t really imagine starting over or transfering all the work over to a new base so i’m hoping to be able to just fix the client or find out what the issue is
the link you posted about the 317 protocol isn’t helpful, sorry

Something is clearly misconfigured within the client.

any clue how to find out what the issue is?

Perhaps do some debugging.
[/quote]
well you sure are helpful
i’ve tried debugging a majority of things, mainly sent packets
what should i debug or do you not know what you’re talking about[/quote]
Yea… he’s actually a boss.

OT: The best thing anyone could recommend is to take a look around and see if the issue has been brought up anywhere else. Maybe they found a fix for it in the original DL thread?

Read full topic

item.title: [Delta] Random Login Freeze
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“silabgarza, post:5, topic:471568”]well i believe it has something to do with my client
as far as i remember, it didn’t happen back int 2010/2011 with project fuubergen client as base
but now in 2011 i started using runelimited, and i believe that’s when this issue started happening
i’ve done so much work on the client and can’t really imagine starting over or transfering all the work over to a new base so i’m hoping to be able to just fix the client or find out what the issue is
the link you posted about the 317 protocol isn’t helpful, sorry[/quote]
It should give you some idea’s on the protocols they use to login. Those are the packets that would/should be lost if you are having this error. I see no other documentation on what could be causing this error. If it started on the fuubernen base, look around for how they solved that.
Or you can test different client and or server. see if the connections still break between the new client and old server, and new server and old client.

Read full topic

item.title: [Delta] Random Login Freeze
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“silabgarza, post:3, topic:471568”]there are no printouts
basically, packet processing stops until the user relogs[/quote]
That means you have packet loss in your clients connection to your server.
Give me a minute to look for a solution
Edit: http://rsps.wikia.com/wiki/317_Protocol
Not a solution, but look at the login protocol. Some of the packets might be familiar.

Read full topic

@silabgarza wrote:

Okay i’ve had this issue for quite some time, i’ve heard of others having the same issue

so hopefully someone will know if there is possibly a solution for it

note: this bug is completely random, it doesn’t do it all the time but it does it often enough to cause an issue.

okay so then, the bug goes like this

the player logs in, after login is finished, the player is unable to move, click any buttons, talk, etc
All of their actions are disregarded, there only option is to restart their client.

After tons of debugs and testing, i’ve found that it randomly spits out 3-5 random packets ranging from 1-255

if anyone has any idea about this or any solutions, please let me know, any help is appreciated. thank you very much!
